topics.title: Community Engagement
topics.summary: The npmx community is thriving, with over 150 contributors collaborating on the project. Recent posts express gratitude for teamwork and highlight the positive atmosphere within the community, fostering a collaborative environment for development.

topics.title: UI Enhancements and Fixes
topics.summary: Recent PRs have focused on improving the user interface, including fixes for overlapping watermarks, correct install sizes for native packages, and ensuring the footer is visible when scrolling. These enhancements aim to provide a better user experience and address previous issues reported by users.

topics.title: Feature Additions
topics.summary: New features have been introduced, such as a skeleton debugging tool for better development insights and a permalink for the downloads modal. These additions enhance functionality and usability, allowing users to interact with the application more effectively.

topics.title: Bug Fixes and Issue Resolutions
topics.summary: Several issues have been addressed, including a display bug when adding a new maintainer and converting the ChartModal to a dedicated modal route. These fixes improve the overall functionality and user experience of the application.

topics.title: Version Management Improvements
topics.summary: Improvements have been made to how package versions are displayed, including highlighting the selected version in the Versions section. This addresses user feedback regarding clarity and usability when navigating through different package versions.
